conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time graph to determine if objects A and B have the same acceleration at time t1.
The graph shows velocity versus time for two objects A and B, both starting at the same location and moving in the same direction.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity, mathematically represented as a = dv/dt, which is the slope of the velocity-time graph at any point.
At time t1, the velocity curve for Object A is a straight line with a positive slope, indicating constant positive acceleration.
At time t1, the velocity curve for Object B appears to be a decreasing curve with a negative slope, indicating negative acceleration.
Since the slopes are different (one positive, one negative), the accelerations are different: Object A has positive acceleration, Object B has negative acceleration.
No, the two objects do not have the same acceleration at time t1. Object A has a positive acceleration while Object B has a negative acceleration at that time.
